title: Web-Based Histology and Histopathology Self-Directed Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: An intensive short-term course conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment, designed to help medical undergraduates holistically acquire core concepts in histology and histopathology.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify the microstructural characteristics of 10 major tissue types (epithelial, connective, muscular, nervous tissues, etc.)
Learners can describe the microscopic features of 15 common histopathological changes (inflammation, necrosis, atrophy, etc.)
Learners can analyze histopathology correlations through self-directed learning for 2 hours daily over 5 days a week using a web-based platform

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
